alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 12:16AM MST until July 30 at 1:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR GILA COUNTY... At 1216 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain fell this evening. Although the heavy rain has ended, runoff will cause flash flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roosevelt Estates and The Salt Burn Scar. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 188 between mile markers 221 and 230. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
